title: How to search for keywords for a blog - Quora

response.answer_text: As everything and everyone is evolving so does the methods and techniques too. Who knew that newspapers and articles would be replaced by internet through videos, websites etc. Earlier articles were in trend but that too they weren’t published on a daily basis, particular time period was allotted. Whereas now blog is trending and that too so vigorously. While the term "blog" was not coined until the late 1990′s, the history of blogging starts with several digital precursors to it. Before "blogging" became popular, digital communities took many forms. Keywords are an extension of your organic reach, meaning that they will allow you to attract readers with a genuine interest in what your blog has to offer. Of course, if you create a good keyword strategy that isn’t misleading. Organic traffic is the most valuable asset for your blog, and you need to have as much of it as possible to grow your blog. Find seed keywordsLearn from competitorsFind core keywords and gather search volumesUse keyword research toolsStay updated and update your keyword researchDo not rush for the sameStick to your niche and only build keywords according to it.

There are many ways to find best keywords for your blog. Some of them are: Related searchesRelated questionsKeyword combinationCompetitor keywordsKeyword PlannerWhen you research keywords using the above methods, you will find lots of short tail and long tail keywords you can target and get rankings in Google easily. Never target a keyword blindly. Use a good paid keyword research tool other than free tools. It will save your time and money. If not, you may target a keyword you can never rank. It's a mistake.
